text:
Hey! :wave:
Have any of you encountered such an "effect" on the site? I.e. when I scroll the page with the scrollbar pressed, the page loading stops and any animation (until I let go of the scrollbar in the browser) , and when I scroll with the mouse scrollbar, everything works normally and the page loads in the meantime. Does the focus on the scrollbar stop the page loading? On my site it also stops the loading of assets in the network tab (Chrome browser). I use gsap and scrolltrigger for animations on my HubSpot site.
Mega strange. Someone can advise something? I am posting the video.

Hello @All
I have requirement about to show the latest case studies in this our work page. <https://21463471.hs-sites.com/our-work>

Currently, we have shown it manually using the magic module option of the theme.

can you please guide how can i display all the case studies based on recent website page will automatically load here after published?

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Hi,

We are using Gravity forms HubSpot plugin to collect form submissions, but the tracking cookie from HubSpot is not being set to send with the submission. Has anyone else had this problem or know of a solution?
hello everyone, is there any way to place an image between two sections? I'll attach an example here.
Go to the image styles tab and set a negative margin.
Is there a way to convert existing pages into child pages? Or move child-pages from one path to under another path?

How do you mean <@U06CCRJ38LT>?

Do you mean like this:
<http://website.com/child-page|website.com/child-page> to <http://website.com/parentpage/childpage|website.com/parentpage/childpage>?

If your "child page" is published once you change the URL an automatic redirect will be created on HubSpot
Correct. That is what I want to do.  I tried to edit the url path under page settings, but was not allowed to.
You might not have enough permissions perhaps
Yea maybe not. I was able to do this in my dev account, but not on the client account
Must be that then, ask for more permissions :slightly_smiling_face:
